summary: The Disability and Age in Jury Service Nondiscrimination Act aims to prevent discrimination against individuals with disabilities and of a certain age in federal jury selection. The bill amends Title 28 of the United States Code, specifically Section 1862 and Section 1865. It prohibits exclusion from juries based on disability and modifies the qualifications for jury service to accommodate individuals with disabilities where reasonable. The bill's intention is to ensure fairer jury representation and eliminate discrimination in the jury selection process.
